chunks.text:
We propose a 35% discount for partially damaged items and 20% for severely damaged items. However, claiming a 100% depreciation allowance for the goods and retaining them must be corrected. The purpose of the brand and label clause is to prevent the sale of the branded goods through normal market channels. Therefore, the Insured should hand over the salvage after removing their labels from the goods (if possible), or else they have to destroy the goods in the presence of the adjuster and submit a destruction certificate.   

 

Having said the above, for the Insured to retain the damaged goods, we suggest the following:

 

Item

Claim (SR)

Adjustment (SR)

Remarks 

100 units

509,126.00

407,301

20% Discount

35 units

286,359.78

186,134

35% Discount

 

795,485.79

593,435

 

 

Please advise the Insured to confirm that the above is in order so we can finalize this part of the claim.

 

Quote

 

Please call me if you need to discuss.

 

Thanks

Firas

Dear Tarek,

 

Please find below the loss feedback on the submitted documents and requirements,

 

Quote

 

We would like the following clarifications on the stock, fittings, and fixtures.

 

Stock

 

*	The damaged stock items are divided into two parts: fully damaged items and partially damaged items. We would be pleased to receive the Insured’s decisions regarding the partially damaged items. Please advise

For partially damaged items, as per brand policy to be considered as TOTAL DAMAGED as its not salable. Therefore, to be considered as total loss.

*	The supporting supplier’s invoices were reviewed, and we noted that the stock items we could identify showed prices less than the value claimed.  We will adjust the same accordingly;
*	The damaged stock items retain value. Therefore, if the Insured wishes to retain them, please ask them to submit their quotation. Please advise

Unfortunately, as per brand standards we cannot transfer or sell partially damaged items.

 

Fittings and Fixtures  

 

We have noted that Boulevard Co's claim for cleaning/repairing, etc., in the sum of SR.20,700 is based on a proforma invoice, and the Blue Print's claim in the sum of SR.92,675.63 on a quotation. Have the two companies completed the repair/reinstatement works?

Unquote

Dear Tarek,

 

Kindly be informed that the loss adjuster have conducted the survey at the location and inspected the damage. He noted that the rainwater entered the building from the roof, apparently as a result of a defect in either the sealant or drainage system 

Therefore, to progress the matter, we request you submit the following;

 

1.       Statement of claim; /attached.

2.       A copy of the list of the  total  stock  that was in the subject boutique on the subject date from the system with their values / attached

3.       Copies of the supplier’s invoices for the damaged stock items; https://we.tl/t-hluCC9FfgF <https://eur03.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwe.tl%2Ft-hluCC9FfgF&data=05%7C02%7CHagop.Ghazarian%40chalhoub.com%7C1096ab8388364ac772c008dcedc68f33%7C6ef8304cf37b42a5a5690a7d8249fbf3%7C0%7C0%7C638646684429167606%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=tTaTxOPCOQd%2FG31aFnZWb1r89GZC6UeAPij2798f%2FM4%3D&reserved=0>   please download within 3 days.

4.       Cleaning expenses of the showroom from the water/attached.

	Dear Tarek,

	 

	I hope this message finds you well.

	 

	Thank you for visiting the CHANEL Jeddah store this afternoon and conducting a physical inspection. Based on your guidance, we have categorized the damaged stock into two groups:

	 

	• Totally damaged

	• Semi-damaged

	 

	We have placed all damaged items in a designated area for further inspection. As recommended, we have separated the wet and damaged boxes for the Insurance inspector's review during their visit.

	 

	Additionally, you observed and photographed various construction-related damages in the store, including issues with the ceiling, flooring, skirting, wallpaper, doors, shelves, kitchen hood and projector. 

	Please note that the wooden flooring, skirting, and other wood components that have absorbed water may not show immediate damage but should become visible in the coming days. 

	 

	The contractor has informed us that he will provide a preliminary report after tomorrow morning and a final report within a week.

	 

	As discussed, we aim to submit the list of damaged stock items by tomorrow at 11am.

	Regarding the cleaning process, it is still ongoing, and we expect to receive the invoice from the cleaning company within the next two days.

	 

	Please do your best to be present with the inspector tomorrow to address everything at once.

	 

	Thank you.

	 

	Best Regards,

	 

Joe Bou Rjeili

	Dear Tarek, 

	  

	As per your discussion with Joe, we will assess the Chanel Jeddah -El Khayat boutique situation and share with you the pictures, videos & Landed cost of the damaged items after segregating the stock. 

	Additionally, as discussed, we will also provide pictures and videos related to the cleaning process.

	  

	As advised by you, the insurance company will rely on the data we share with them and there will be no need for an insurance surveyor to visit our boutique. 

	Therefore, we can operate the boutique as normal from this afternoon onwards, Kindly confirm.

	  

	We will also try our best to check the CCTV and to provide you with the footage. 

	  

	We will share the cost of the cleaning and provide you with an estimated cost for the boutique repairs after the contractor's assessment.

	  

	Regards

	Fashiuddin Jaffar

		From: Fashiuddin Jaffar <Fashiuddin.Jaffar@etoilegroup.com <mailto:Fashiuddin.Jaffar@etoilegroup.com> >
		Sent: Tuesday, September 3, 2024 8:12:30 AM

		Subject: Ceiling Leakage - Chanel Jeddah Elkhayat. 

		  

		CAUTION: This email originated from outside of the organization. Do not click links or open attachments unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe. 
		تم إرسال هذا البريد الإلكتروني من خارج مجموعة شلهوب. لا تنقر على الروابط أو تفتح المرفقات إلا إذا كنت تعرف المرسل وتعلم أنه آمن

		Dear Tarek.

		Good day.

		  

		Hope you are doing well.

		  

		  

		We are reaching out to let you know about an unfortunate incident at our Chanel Jeddah store last night. Due to the heavy rain, we experienced a water leakage from the ceiling, which has resulted in some damage to our items.

		  

		We're currently assessing the situation and will send you photos of the damaged items soon for the insurance claim.

		  

		Could you please let us know if someone from Nasco team can come to inspect the site?

		  

		Thanks in advance for your Support.

tachalam Yegnes <Venkatachalam.Yegnes@etoilegroup.com>; Moneer Albalawi <Moneer.Albalawi@nascosaudi.com>
Subject: RE: AL NOUJAIMA TRADING CO.-FW: Ceiling Leakage - Chanel Jeddah Elkhayat.- Nasco Ref. N-GA-24-70,

 

CAUTION: This email originated from outside of the organization. Do not click links or open attachments unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe.

 

Dear Firas,

 

I hope this message finds you well.

 

Thank you, as always, for your continued support.

 

We acknowledge the considerations raised regarding the salvage value of the damaged goods. However, in line with our standard practices for previous claims involving fully damaged items, we typically proceed by destroying these items in the presence of the surveyor to receive full compensation.

 

To avoid potential complexities or disputes concerning the brand and trademark clause, specifically regarding the feasibility of removing trademarks and obtaining salvage quotations for the material that remains, we propose the following to expedite settlement and ensure a fair resolution for all parties involved:

 

*	Fully Damaged Items: 

	*	We propose a reduction of 10% from the cost value.
	*	These items will be destroyed under the surveyor's supervision.

*	Partially Damaged Items: 

	*	We propose a reduction of 25% from the cost value.
	*	These items will be retained.

 

This approach is consistent with the methodology used during the Dhahran fire claim, aligns with policy conditions, and, we believe, benefits all parties involved.

 

We kindly request GIG’s confirmation that the above adjustments are acceptable so we can proceed to close this claim promptly.

Dear Tarek,

 

As discussed earlier, please see the below feedback received from the loss adjuster for your reference and advice,

 

Quote

We refer to the claim above and would like you to note that the fully or partially damaged items are valued and can be sold as salvage. Therefore, they retain salvage value.  

   

In the event of a claim for loss, destruction, or damage to branded goods, any salvage of branded goods and/or merchandise shall not be sold without the Insured's prior consent. If such salvage is not sold, the loss, destruction, or damage will be assessed at the value agreed upon between the Insured and the Insurers after removing brands, labels, or names by or on behalf of the Insured. The Insured has the right to remove the brand names from the products before selling them to any interested salvage party. Since removing the labels/brand names without damaging the products is difficult, if not impossible, the Insured must be open to discussing a reasonable percentage of depreciation allowance for the damaged goods with the Insurers. 

 

We propose a 35% discount for partially damaged items and 20% for severely damaged items.

chunks.text:
We propose a 35% discount for partially damaged items and 20% for severely damaged items. However, claiming a 100% depreciation allowance for the goods and retaining them must be corrected. The purpose of the brand and label clause is to prevent the sale of the branded goods through normal market channels. Therefore, the Insured should hand over the salvage after removing their labels from the goods (if possible), or else they have to destroy the goods in the presence of the adjuster and submit a destruction certificate.   

 

Having said the above, for the Insured to retain the damaged goods, we suggest the following:

 

Item

Claim (SR)

Adjustment (SR)

Remarks 

100 units

509,126.00

407,301

20% Discount

35 units

286,359.78

186,134

35% Discount

 

795,485.79

593,435

 

 

Please advise the Insured to confirm that the above is in order so we can finalize this part of the claim.

 

Quote

 

Please call me if you need to discuss.

 

Thanks

Firas

Dear Tarek,

 

Please find below the loss feedback on the submitted documents and requirements,

 

Quote

 

We would like the following clarifications on the stock, fittings, and fixtures.

 

Stock

 

*	The damaged stock items are divided into two parts: fully damaged items and partially damaged items. We would be pleased to receive the Insured’s decisions regarding the partially damaged items. Please advise

For partially damaged items, as per brand policy to be considered as TOTAL DAMAGED as its not salable. Therefore, to be considered as total loss.

*	The supporting supplier’s invoices were reviewed, and we noted that the stock items we could identify showed prices less than the value claimed.  We will adjust the same accordingly;
*	The damaged stock items retain value. Therefore, if the Insured wishes to retain them, please ask them to submit their quotation. Please advise

Unfortunately, as per brand standards we cannot transfer or sell partially damaged items.

 

Fittings and Fixtures  

 

We have noted that Boulevard Co's claim for cleaning/repairing, etc., in the sum of SR.20,700 is based on a proforma invoice, and the Blue Print's claim in the sum of SR.92,675.63 on a quotation. Have the two companies completed the repair/reinstatement works?

Have the two companies completed the repair/reinstatement works? If so, we require the actual invoices and evidence of the payment made to them. Please advise

We will share proof of payment soon, for BLUE PRINT the work is still in progress as of now. 

Please note, the revised claim attached has “Trouble Shooting & repair of Fire Alarm System- BLUE PRINT SAR 10,062.50 (VAT Inclusive)” included from our end. Please adjust accordingly.

 

 

Unquote

 

Thanks

Firas

Dear Tarek,

 

Kindly be informed that the loss adjuster have conducted the survey at the location and inspected the damage. He noted that the rainwater entered the building from the roof, apparently as a result of a defect in either the sealant or drainage system 

Therefore, to progress the matter, we request you submit the following;

 

1.       Statement of claim; /attached.

2.       A copy of the list of the  total  stock  that was in the subject boutique on the subject date from the system with their values / attached

3.       Copies of the supplier’s invoices for the damaged stock items; https://we.tl/t-hluCC9FfgF <https://eur03.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwe.tl%2Ft-hluCC9FfgF&data=05%7C02%7CHagop.Ghazarian%40chalhoub.com%7C8270c6c844094bdf011208dcee6a401b%7C6ef8304cf37b42a5a5690a7d8249fbf3%7C0%7C0%7C638647387401812847%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=ZRMmuDHDGul4t95HLUe9w3SQuOB9FfJn%2BYPBFuPQkWo%3D&reserved=0>   please download within 3 days.

4.       Cleaning expenses of the showroom from the water/attached.

	Dear Tarek,

	 

	I hope this message finds you well.

	 

	Thank you for visiting the CHANEL Jeddah store this afternoon and conducting a physical inspection. Based on your guidance, we have categorized the damaged stock into two groups:

	 

	• Totally damaged

	• Semi-damaged

	 

	We have placed all damaged items in a designated area for further inspection. As recommended, we have separated the wet and damaged boxes for the Insurance inspector's review during their visit.

	 

	Additionally, you observed and photographed various construction-related damages in the store, including issues with the ceiling, flooring, skirting, wallpaper, doors, shelves, kitchen hood and projector. 

	Please note that the wooden flooring, skirting, and other wood components that have absorbed water may not show immediate damage but should become visible in the coming days. 

	 

	The contractor has informed us that he will provide a preliminary report after tomorrow morning and a final report within a week.

	 

	As discussed, we aim to submit the list of damaged stock items by tomorrow at 11am.

	Thank you.

	 

	Best Regards,

	 

Joe Bou Rjeili

	Dear Tarek, 

	  

	As per your discussion with Joe, we will assess the Chanel Jeddah -El Khayat boutique situation and share with you the pictures, videos & Landed cost of the damaged items after segregating the stock. 

	Additionally, as discussed, we will also provide pictures and videos related to the cleaning process.

	  

	As advised by you, the insurance company will rely on the data we share with them and there will be no need for an insurance surveyor to visit our boutique. 

	Therefore, we can operate the boutique as normal from this afternoon onwards, Kindly confirm.

	  

	We will also try our best to check the CCTV and to provide you with the footage. 

	  

	We will share the cost of the cleaning and provide you with an estimated cost for the boutique repairs after the contractor's assessment.

	  

	Regards

	Fashiuddin Jaffar

		Subject: Ceiling Leakage - Chanel Jeddah Elkhayat. 

		  

		CAUTION: This email originated from outside of the organization. Do not click links or open attachments unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe. 
		تم إرسال هذا البريد الإلكتروني من خارج مجموعة شلهوب. لا تنقر على الروابط أو تفتح المرفقات إلا إذا كنت تعرف المرسل وتعلم أنه آمن

		Dear Tarek.

		Good day.

		  

		Hope you are doing well.

		  

		  

		We are reaching out to let you know about an unfortunate incident at our Chanel Jeddah store last night. Due to the heavy rain, we experienced a water leakage from the ceiling, which has resulted in some damage to our items.

		  

		We're currently assessing the situation and will send you photos of the damaged items soon for the insurance claim.

		  

		Could you please let us know if someone from Nasco team can come to inspect the site?

		  

		Thanks in advance for your Support.

Dear Firas,

 

I hope this message finds you well.

 

Thank you, as always, for your continued support.

 

We acknowledge the considerations raised regarding the salvage value of the damaged goods. However, in line with our standard practices for previous claims involving fully damaged items, we typically proceed by destroying these items in the presence of the surveyor to receive full compensation.

 

To avoid potential complexities or disputes concerning the brand and trademark clause, specifically regarding the feasibility of removing trademarks and obtaining salvage quotations for the material that remains, we propose the following to expedite settlement and ensure a fair resolution for all parties involved:

 

*	Fully Damaged Items: 

	*	We propose a reduction of 10% from the cost value.
	*	These items will be destroyed under the surveyor's supervision.

*	Partially Damaged Items: 

	*	We propose a reduction of 25% from the cost value.
	*	These items will be retained.

 

This approach is consistent with the methodology used during the Dhahran fire claim, aligns with policy conditions, and, we believe, benefits all parties involved.

 

We kindly request GIG’s confirmation that the above adjustments are acceptable so we can proceed to close this claim promptly.

Dear Tarek,

 

As discussed earlier, please see the below feedback received from the loss adjuster for your reference and advice,

 

Quote

We refer to the claim above and would like you to note that the fully or partially damaged items are valued and can be sold as salvage. Therefore, they retain salvage value.  

   

In the event of a claim for loss, destruction, or damage to branded goods, any salvage of branded goods and/or merchandise shall not be sold without the Insured's prior consent. If such salvage is not sold, the loss, destruction, or damage will be assessed at the value agreed upon between the Insured and the Insurers after removing brands, labels, or names by or on behalf of the Insured. The Insured has the right to remove the brand names from the products before selling them to any interested salvage party. Since removing the labels/brand names without damaging the products is difficult, if not impossible, the Insured must be open to discussing a reasonable percentage of depreciation allowance for the damaged goods with the Insurers. 

 

We propose a 35% discount for partially damaged items and 20% for severely damaged items.

We propose a 35% discount for partially damaged items and 20% for severely damaged items. However, claiming a 100% depreciation allowance for the goods and retaining them must be corrected. The purpose of the brand and label clause is to prevent the sale of the branded goods through normal market channels. Therefore, the Insured should hand over the salvage after removing their labels from the goods (if possible), or else they have to destroy the goods in the presence of the adjuster and submit a destruction certificate.   

 

Having said the above, for the Insured to retain the damaged goods, we suggest the following:

Dear Tarek,

 

Please find below the loss feedback on the submitted documents and requirements,

 

Quote

 

We would like the following clarifications on the stock, fittings, and fixtures.

 

Stock

 

*	The damaged stock items are divided into two parts: fully damaged items and partially damaged items. We would be pleased to receive the Insured’s decisions regarding the partially damaged items. Please advise

For partially damaged items, as per brand policy to be considered as TOTAL DAMAGED as its not salable. Therefore, to be considered as total loss.

*	The supporting supplier’s invoices were reviewed, and we noted that the stock items we could identify showed prices less than the value claimed.  We will adjust the same accordingly;
*	The damaged stock items retain value. Therefore, if the Insured wishes to retain them, please ask them to submit their quotation. Please advise

Unfortunately, as per brand standards we cannot transfer or sell partially damaged items.

 

Fittings and Fixtures  

 

We have noted that Boulevard Co's claim for cleaning/repairing, etc., in the sum of SR.20,700 is based on a proforma invoice, and the Blue Print's claim in the sum of SR.92,675.63 on a quotation. Have the two companies completed the repair/reinstatement works?

Please note, the revised claim attached has “Trouble Shooting & repair of Fire Alarm System- BLUE PRINT SAR 10,062.50 (VAT Inclusive)” included from our end. Please adjust accordingly.

 

 

Unquote

 

Thanks

Firas

Dear Tarek,

 

Kindly be informed that the loss adjuster have conducted the survey at the location and inspected the damage. He noted that the rainwater entered the building from the roof, apparently as a result of a defect in either the sealant or drainage system 

Therefore, to progress the matter, we request you submit the following;

 

1.       Statement of claim; /attached.

2.       A copy of the list of the  total  stock  that was in the subject boutique on the subject date from the system with their values / attached

3.       Copies of the supplier’s invoices for the damaged stock items; https://we.tl/t-hluCC9FfgF <https://eur03.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwe.tl%2Ft-hluCC9FfgF&data=05%7C02%7CHagop.Ghazarian%40chalhoub.com%7Cbaca7ac95d01488540f708dcf2977892%7C6ef8304cf37b42a5a5690a7d8249fbf3%7C0%7C0%7C638651979666798229%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=jNK6huk6WgaIGeP3nGKLhLlG%2BjIs0iZlHnEaMk%2BLdM8%3D&reserved=0>   please download within 3 days.

4.       Cleaning expenses of the showroom from the water/attached.

o:Svetlana.Moiseeva@etoilegroup.com> >; Fashiuddin Jaffar <Fashiuddin.Jaffar@etoilegroup.com <mailto:Fashiuddin.Jaffar@etoilegroup.com> >
	Subject: RE: Ceiling Leakage - Chanel Jeddah Elkhayat.

	تم إرسال هذا البريد الإلكتروني من خارج مجموعة شلهوب. لا تنقر على الروابط أو تفتح المرفقات إلا إذا كنت تعرف المرسل وتعلم أنه آمن

	Dear Tarek,

	 

	I hope this message finds you well.

	 

	Thank you for visiting the CHANEL Jeddah store this afternoon and conducting a physical inspection. Based on your guidance, we have categorized the damaged stock into two groups:

	 

	• Totally damaged

	• Semi-damaged

	 

	We have placed all damaged items in a designated area for further inspection. As recommended, we have separated the wet and damaged boxes for the Insurance inspector's review during their visit.

	 

	Additionally, you observed and photographed various construction-related damages in the store, including issues with the ceiling, flooring, skirting, wallpaper, doors, shelves, kitchen hood and projector. 

	Please note that the wooden flooring, skirting, and other wood components that have absorbed water may not show immediate damage but should become visible in the coming days. 

	 

	The contractor has informed us that he will provide a preliminary report after tomorrow morning and a final report within a week.

	 

	As discussed, we aim to submit the list of damaged stock items by tomorrow at 11am.

	Regarding the cleaning process, it is still ongoing, and we expect to receive the invoice from the cleaning company within the next two days.

	 

	Please do your best to be present with the inspector tomorrow to address everything at once.

	 

	Thank you.

	 

	Best Regards,

	 

Joe Bou Rjeili

	Dear Tarek, 

	  

	As per your discussion with Joe, we will assess the Chanel Jeddah -El Khayat boutique situation and share with you the pictures, videos & Landed cost of the damaged items after segregating the stock. 

	Additionally, as discussed, we will also provide pictures and videos related to the cleaning process.

	  

	As advised by you, the insurance company will rely on the data we share with them and there will be no need for an insurance surveyor to visit our boutique. 

	Therefore, we can operate the boutique as normal from this afternoon onwards, Kindly confirm.

	  

	We will also try our best to check the CCTV and to provide you with the footage. 

	  

	We will share the cost of the cleaning and provide you with an estimated cost for the boutique repairs after the contractor's assessment.

	  

	Regards

	Fashiuddin Jaffar

		Subject: Ceiling Leakage - Chanel Jeddah Elkhayat. 

		  

		CAUTION: This email originated from outside of the organization. Do not click links or open attachments unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe. 
		تم إرسال هذا البريد الإلكتروني من خارج مجموعة شلهوب. لا تنقر على الروابط أو تفتح المرفقات إلا إذا كنت تعرف المرسل وتعلم أنه آمن

		Dear Tarek.

		Good day.

		  

		Hope you are doing well.

		  

		  

		We are reaching out to let you know about an unfortunate incident at our Chanel Jeddah store last night. Due to the heavy rain, we experienced a water leakage from the ceiling, which has resulted in some damage to our items.

		  

		We're currently assessing the situation and will send you photos of the damaged items soon for the insurance claim.

		  

		Could you please let us know if someone from Nasco team can come to inspect the site?

		  

		Thanks in advance for your Support.

Dear Tarek,

 

As discussed earlier, please see the below feedback received from the loss adjuster for your reference and advice,

 

Quote

We refer to the claim above and would like you to note that the fully or partially damaged items are valued and can be sold as salvage. Therefore, they retain salvage value.  

   

In the event of a claim for loss, destruction, or damage to branded goods, any salvage of branded goods and/or merchandise shall not be sold without the Insured's prior consent. If such salvage is not sold, the loss, destruction, or damage will be assessed at the value agreed upon between the Insured and the Insurers after removing brands, labels, or names by or on behalf of the Insured. The Insured has the right to remove the brand names from the products before selling them to any interested salvage party. Since removing the labels/brand names without damaging the products is difficult, if not impossible, the Insured must be open to discussing a reasonable percentage of depreciation allowance for the damaged goods with the Insurers. 

 

We propose a 35% discount for partially damaged items and 20% for severely damaged items. However, claiming a 100% depreciation allowance for the goods and retaining them must be corrected.

chunks.text:
However, claiming a 100% depreciation allowance for the goods and retaining them must be corrected. The purpose of the brand and label clause is to prevent the sale of the branded goods through normal market channels. Therefore, the Insured should hand over the salvage after removing their labels from the goods (if possible), or else they have to destroy the goods in the presence of the adjuster and submit a destruction certificate.   

 

Having said the above, for the Insured to retain the damaged goods, we suggest the following:

Thanks

Firas

Dear Tarek,

 

Please find below the loss feedback on the submitted documents and requirements,

 

Quote

 

We would like the following clarifications on the stock, fittings, and fixtures.

 

Stock

 

*	The damaged stock items are divided into two parts: fully damaged items and partially damaged items. We would be pleased to receive the Insured’s decisions regarding the partially damaged items. Please advise

For partially damaged items, as per brand policy to be considered as TOTAL DAMAGED as its not salable. Therefore, to be considered as total loss.

*	The supporting supplier’s invoices were reviewed, and we noted that the stock items we could identify showed prices less than the value claimed.  We will adjust the same accordingly;
*	The damaged stock items retain value. Therefore, if the Insured wishes to retain them, please ask them to submit their quotation. Please advise

Unfortunately, as per brand standards we cannot transfer or sell partially damaged items.

 

Fittings and Fixtures  

 

We have noted that Boulevard Co's claim for cleaning/repairing, etc., in the sum of SR.20,700 is based on a proforma invoice, and the Blue Print's claim in the sum of SR.92,675.63 on a quotation. Have the two companies completed the repair/reinstatement works?

Please note, the revised claim attached has “Trouble Shooting & repair of Fire Alarm System- BLUE PRINT SAR 10,062.50 (VAT Inclusive)” included from our end. Please adjust accordingly.

 

 

Unquote

 

Thanks

Firas

Dear Tarek,

 

Kindly be informed that the loss adjuster have conducted the survey at the location and inspected the damage. He noted that the rainwater entered the building from the roof, apparently as a result of a defect in either the sealant or drainage system 

Therefore, to progress the matter, we request you submit the following;

 

1.      Statement of claim; /attached.

o:Svetlana.Moiseeva@etoilegroup.com> >; Fashiuddin Jaffar <Fashiuddin.Jaffar@etoilegroup.com <mailto:Fashiuddin.Jaffar@etoilegroup.com> >
	Subject: RE: Ceiling Leakage - Chanel Jeddah Elkhayat.

	 

	CAUTION: This email originated from outside of the organization. Do not click links or open attachments unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe. 
	تم إرسال هذا البريد الإلكتروني من خارج مجموعة شلهوب. لا تنقر على الروابط أو تفتح المرفقات إلا إذا كنت تعرف المرسل وتعلم أنه آمن

	Dear Tarek,

	 

	I hope this message finds you well.

	 

	Thank you for visiting the CHANEL Jeddah store this afternoon and conducting a physical inspection. Based on your guidance, we have categorized the damaged stock into two groups:

	 

	• Totally damaged

	• Semi-damaged

	 

	We have placed all damaged items in a designated area for further inspection. As recommended, we have separated the wet and damaged boxes for the Insurance inspector's review during their visit.

	 

	Additionally, you observed and photographed various construction-related damages in the store, including issues with the ceiling, flooring, skirting, wallpaper, doors, shelves, kitchen hood and projector. 

	Please note that the wooden flooring, skirting, and other wood components that have absorbed water may not show immediate damage but should become visible in the coming days. 

	 

	The contractor has informed us that he will provide a preliminary report after tomorrow morning and a final report within a week.

	 

	As discussed, we aim to submit the list of damaged stock items by tomorrow at 11am.

	Regarding the cleaning process, it is still ongoing, and we expect to receive the invoice from the cleaning company within the next two days.

	 

	Please do your best to be present with the inspector tomorrow to address everything at once.

	 

	Thank you.

	 

	Best Regards,

	 

Joe Bou Rjeili

ancois.Schweitzer@etoilegroup.com> >; Svetlana Moiseeva <Svetlana.Moiseeva@etoilegroup.com <mailto:Svetlana.Moiseeva@etoilegroup.com> >
	Subject: RE: Ceiling Leakage - Chanel Jeddah Elkhayat. 

	  

	CAUTION: This email originated from outside of the organization. Do not click links or open attachments unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe. 
	تم إرسال هذا البريد الإلكتروني من خارج مجموعة شلهوب. لا تنقر على الروابط أو تفتح المرفقات إلا إذا كنت تعرف المرسل وتعلم أنه آمن

	Dear Tarek, 

	  

	As per your discussion with Joe, we will assess the Chanel Jeddah -El Khayat boutique situation and share with you the pictures, videos & Landed cost of the damaged items after segregating the stock. 

	Additionally, as discussed, we will also provide pictures and videos related to the cleaning process.

	  

	As advised by you, the insurance company will rely on the data we share with them and there will be no need for an insurance surveyor to visit our boutique. 

	Therefore, we can operate the boutique as normal from this afternoon onwards, Kindly confirm.

	  

	We will also try our best to check the CCTV and to provide you with the footage. 

	  

	We will share the cost of the cleaning and provide you with an estimated cost for the boutique repairs after the contractor's assessment.

	  

	Regards

	Fashiuddin Jaffar

	  

Al Nujaima Trading Company LTD.,

Office No. 106, 1st Floor, Gate 3, 

El Khayyat Centre

Tahlia Street, Andalus District

Jeddah, Saudi Arabia

P.O. Box 53270 Jeddah 21583, Saudi Arabia

Tel +966 (12) 660 3820 / 660 3406 / 284 2863 / 284 2865

		Dear Tarek.

		Good day.

		  

		Hope you are doing well.

		  

		  

		We are reaching out to let you know about an unfortunate incident at our Chanel Jeddah store last night. Due to the heavy rain, we experienced a water leakage from the ceiling, which has resulted in some damage to our items.

		  

		We're currently assessing the situation and will send you photos of the damaged items soon for the insurance claim.

		  

		Could you please let us know if someone from Nasco team can come to inspect the site?

		  

		Thanks in advance for your Support.

Dear Firas,

I hope you’re doing well. Thank you for sharing the proposal.

Nujaima has requested to keep all the items, as there may be a need to send the damaged products to France if requested by the brand. Given this, we propose adjusting the settlement amount to SAR 625,000, down from the SAR 709,578, and retain the items.

This adjustment is also in the insurer’s favor, as it will noticeably reduce the net claim outlay.

If this proposal is acceptable, kindly provide us with the form of acceptance to sign, stamp, and return in order to close this claim.

As always, appreciate your continuous support.

Dear Firas,

 

I hope this message finds you well.

 

Thank you, as always, for your continued support.

 

We acknowledge the considerations raised regarding the salvage value of the damaged goods. However, in line with our standard practices for previous claims involving fully damaged items, we typically proceed by destroying these items in the presence of the surveyor to receive full compensation.

 

To avoid potential complexities or disputes concerning the brand and trademark clause, specifically regarding the feasibility of removing trademarks and obtaining salvage quotations for the material that remains, we propose the following to expedite settlement and ensure a fair resolution for all parties involved:

 

*	Fully Damaged Items:

	*	We propose a reduction of 10% from the cost value.
	*	These items will be destroyed under the surveyor's supervision.

*	Partially Damaged Items:

	*	We propose a reduction of 25% from the cost value.
	*	These items will be retained.

 

This approach is consistent with the methodology used during the Dhahran fire claim, aligns with policy conditions, and, we believe, benefits all parties involved.

 

We kindly request GIG’s confirmation that the above adjustments are acceptable so we can proceed to close this claim promptly.

Dear Tarek,

 

As discussed earlier, please see the below feedback received from the loss adjuster for your reference and advice,

 

Quote

We refer to the claim above and would like you to note that the fully or partially damaged items are valued and can be sold as salvage. Therefore, they retain salvage value. 

   

In the event of a claim for loss, destruction, or damage to branded goods, any salvage of branded goods and/or merchandise shall not be sold without the Insured's prior consent. If such salvage is not sold, the loss, destruction, or damage will be assessed at the value agreed upon between the Insured and the Insurers after removing brands, labels, or names by or on behalf of the Insured. The Insured has the right to remove the brand names from the products before selling them to any interested salvage party. Since removing the labels/brand names without damaging the products is difficult, if not impossible, the Insured must be open to discussing a reasonable percentage of depreciation allowance for the damaged goods with the Insurers.

 

We propose a 35% discount for partially damaged items and 20% for severely damaged items.

We propose a 35% discount for partially damaged items and 20% for severely damaged items. However, claiming a 100% depreciation allowance for the goods and retaining them must be corrected. The purpose of the brand and label clause is to prevent the sale of the branded goods through normal market channels. Therefore, the Insured should hand over the salvage after removing their labels from the goods (if possible), or else they have to destroy the goods in the presence of the adjuster and submit a destruction certificate.  

 

Having said the above, for the Insured to retain the damaged goods, we suggest the following:

Adjustment (SR)

Remarks

509,126.00

Quote

 

Please call me if you need to discuss.

 

Thanks

Firas

Dear Tarek,

 

Please find below the loss feedback on the submitted documents and requirements,

 

Quote

 

We would like the following clarifications on the stock, fittings, and fixtures.

 

Stock

 

*	The damaged stock items are divided into two parts: fully damaged items and partially damaged items. We would be pleased to receive the Insured’s decisions regarding the partially damaged items. Please advise

For partially damaged items, as per brand policy to be considered as TOTAL DAMAGED as its not salable. Therefore, to be considered as total loss.

*	The supporting supplier’s invoices were reviewed, and we noted that the stock items we could identify showed prices less than the value claimed.  We will adjust the same accordingly;
*	The damaged stock items retain value. Therefore, if the Insured wishes to retain them, please ask them to submit their quotation. Please advise

Unfortunately, as per brand standards we cannot transfer or sell partially damaged items.

 

Fittings and Fixtures  

 

We have noted that Boulevard Co's claim for cleaning/repairing, etc., in the sum of SR.20,700 is based on a proforma invoice, and the Blue Print's claim in the sum of SR.92,675.63 on a quotation. Have the two companies completed the repair/reinstatement works? If so, we require the actual invoices and evidence of the payment made to them. Please advise

We will share proof of payment soon, for BLUE PRINT the work is still in progress as of now.

Dear Tarek,

 

Kindly be informed that the loss adjuster have conducted the survey at the location and inspected the damage. He noted that the rainwater entered the building from the roof, apparently as a result of a defect in either the sealant or drainage system

Therefore, to progress the matter, we request you submit the following;

 

1.       Statement of claim; /attached.

2.       A copy of the list of the  total  stock  that was in the subject boutique on the subject date from the system with their values / attached

3.       Copies of the supplier’s invoices for the damaged stock items; https://we.tl/t-hluCC9FfgF  please download within 3 days.

4.       Cleaning expenses of the showroom from the water/attached.

5.       Repair invoices for the part of the ceiling and/or the parkie floor affected by the water; @Joe Bourjeili <mailto:joe.bourjeili@etoilegroup.com> 

6.       A copy of the letter sent to the landlord for the loss/damage caused by the water due to the defective roof of the building and their reply /attached.

7.       We understand that the showroom was opened for trade within a day or two.

	Dear Tarek,

	 

	I hope this message finds you well.

	 

	Thank you for visiting the CHANEL Jeddah store this afternoon and conducting a physical inspection. Based on your guidance, we have categorized the damaged stock into two groups:

	 

	• Totally damaged

	• Semi-damaged

	 

	We have placed all damaged items in a designated area for further inspection. As recommended, we have separated the wet and damaged boxes for the Insurance inspector's review during their visit.

	 

	Additionally, you observed and photographed various construction-related damages in the store, including issues with the ceiling, flooring, skirting, wallpaper, doors, shelves, kitchen hood and projector.

	Please note that the wooden flooring, skirting, and other wood components that have absorbed water may not show immediate damage but should become visible in the coming days.

	 

	The contractor has informed us that he will provide a preliminary report after tomorrow morning and a final report within a week.

	 

	As discussed, we aim to submit the list of damaged stock items by tomorrow at 11am.

	 

	Regarding the cleaning process, it is still ongoing, and we expect to receive the invoice from the cleaning company within the next two days.

	Dear Tarek,

	 

	As per your discussion with Joe, we will assess the Chanel Jeddah -El Khayat boutique situation and share with you the pictures, videos & Landed cost of the damaged items after segregating the stock.

	Additionally, as discussed, we will also provide pictures and videos related to the cleaning process.

	 

	As advised by you, the insurance company will rely on the data we share with them and there will be no need for an insurance surveyor to visit our boutique.

	Therefore, we can operate the boutique as normal from this afternoon onwards, Kindly confirm.

	 

	We will also try our best to check the CCTV and to provide you with the footage.

	 

	We will share the cost of the cleaning and provide you with an estimated cost for the boutique repairs after the contractor's assessment.

	 

	Regards

	Fashiuddin Jaffar

chunks.text:
We are reaching out to let you know about an unfortunate incident at our Chanel Jeddah store last night. Due to the heavy rain, we experienced a water leakage from the ceiling, which has resulted in some damage to our items.

		 

		We're currently assessing the situation and will send you photos of the damaged items soon for the insurance claim.

		 

		Could you please let us know if someone from Nasco team can come to inspect the site?

		 

		Thanks in advance for your Support.

		 

		Regards, 

		Fashiuddin

Dear Firas,

 

I hope you’re doing well. Thank you for sharing the proposal.

 

Nujaima has requested to keep all the items, as there may be a need to send the damaged products to France if requested by the brand. Given this, we propose adjusting the settlement amount to SAR 625,000, down from the SAR 709,578, and retain the items.

 

This adjustment is also in the insurer’s favor, as it will noticeably reduce the net claim outlay.

 

If this proposal is acceptable, kindly provide us with the form of acceptance to sign, stamp, and return in order to close this claim.

 

As always, appreciate your continuous support.

 

Thank You & Best Regards,

Hagop

Hi Hagop,

 

We managed to reach to the following agreement with the insurer/LA

 

Quote

We have checked the same with the Insurers and they have agreed to the following :

 

1 destruction of the heavily damaged  100 bags under our watch supported by municipality destruction certificate

2. Adjustment of the slightly damaged 35 bags at 30% discount. So please advise the Insured to provide us with the date and time they wish to destroy the 100 bags and obtaining the destruction certificate so we can witness the destruction process

Unquote

 

As discussed, the additional 5% on your proposed deduction of 25% of the partially damaged items will be around SR 14,300 only where the 10% of the totally damaged items would be 50K.

 

Accordingly, the loss adjuster will only apply the 30% on the partially damaged items as follow:

 

Item

Claim (SR)

Adjustment (SR)

Remarks

100 units

509,126.00

509,126

Destruction Cert.

35 units

286,359.78

200,452

30% Discount

 

795,485.79

709,578

 

 

Please confirm and share with us the above details so we can proceed.

 

Thanks

Dear Firas,

 

I hope this message finds you well.

 

Thank you, as always, for your continued support.

 

We acknowledge the considerations raised regarding the salvage value of the damaged goods. However, in line with our standard practices for previous claims involving fully damaged items, we typically proceed by destroying these items in the presence of the surveyor to receive full compensation.

 

To avoid potential complexities or disputes concerning the brand and trademark clause, specifically regarding the feasibility of removing trademarks and obtaining salvage quotations for the material that remains, we propose the following to expedite settlement and ensure a fair resolution for all parties involved:

 

*	Fully Damaged Items: 

	*	We propose a reduction of 10% from the cost value.
	*	These items will be destroyed under the surveyor's supervision.

*	Partially Damaged Items: 

	*	We propose a reduction of 25% from the cost value.
	*	These items will be retained.

 

This approach is consistent with the methodology used during the Dhahran fire claim, aligns with policy conditions, and, we believe, benefits all parties involved.

 

We kindly request GIG’s confirmation that the above adjustments are acceptable so we can proceed to close this claim promptly.

 

Warm regards,

Hagop

 

HAGOP GHAZARIAN​​​​

DUBAI

Dear Tarek,

 

As discussed earlier, please see the below feedback received from the loss adjuster for your reference and advice,

 

Quote

We refer to the claim above and would like you to note that the fully or partially damaged items are valued and can be sold as salvage. Therefore, they retain salvage value. 

   

In the event of a claim for loss, destruction, or damage to branded goods, any salvage of branded goods and/or merchandise shall not be sold without the Insured's prior consent. If such salvage is not sold, the loss, destruction, or damage will be assessed at the value agreed upon between the Insured and the Insurers after removing brands, labels, or names by or on behalf of the Insured. The Insured has the right to remove the brand names from the products before selling them to any interested salvage party. Since removing the labels/brand names without damaging the products is difficult, if not impossible, the Insured must be open to discussing a reasonable percentage of depreciation allowance for the damaged goods with the Insurers.

 

We propose a 35% discount for partially damaged items and 20% for severely damaged items.

We propose a 35% discount for partially damaged items and 20% for severely damaged items. However, claiming a 100% depreciation allowance for the goods and retaining them must be corrected. The purpose of the brand and label clause is to prevent the sale of the branded goods through normal market channels. Therefore, the Insured should hand over the salvage after removing their labels from the goods (if possible), or else they have to destroy the goods in the presence of the adjuster and submit a destruction certificate.  

 

Having said the above, for the Insured to retain the damaged goods, we suggest the following:

 

Item

Claim (SR)

Adjustment (SR)

Remarks

100 units

509,126.00

407,301

20% Discount

35 units

286,359.78

186,134

35% Discount

 

795,485.79

593,435

 

 

Please advise the Insured to confirm that the above is in order so we can finalize this part of the claim.

 

Quote

 

Please call me if you need to discuss.

 

Thanks

Firas

Dear Tarek,

 

Please find below the loss feedback on the submitted documents and requirements,

 

Quote

 

We would like the following clarifications on the stock, fittings, and fixtures.

 

Stock

 

*	The damaged stock items are divided into two parts: fully damaged items and partially damaged items. We would be pleased to receive the Insured’s decisions regarding the partially damaged items. Please advise

For partially damaged items, as per brand policy to be considered as TOTAL DAMAGED as its not salable. Therefore, to be considered as total loss.

*	The supporting supplier’s invoices were reviewed, and we noted that the stock items we could identify showed prices less than the value claimed.  We will adjust the same accordingly;
*	The damaged stock items retain value. Therefore, if the Insured wishes to retain them, please ask them to submit their quotation. Please advise

Unfortunately, as per brand standards we cannot transfer or sell partially damaged items.

 

Fittings and Fixtures  

 

We have noted that Boulevard Co's claim for cleaning/repairing, etc., in the sum of SR.20,700 is based on a proforma invoice, and the Blue Print's claim in the sum of SR.92,675.63 on a quotation. Have the two companies completed the repair/reinstatement works?

Have the two companies completed the repair/reinstatement works? If so, we require the actual invoices and evidence of the payment made to them. Please advise

We will share proof of payment soon, for BLUE PRINT the work is still in progress as of now.

Please note, the revised claim attached has “Trouble Shooting & repair of Fire Alarm System- BLUE PRINT SAR 10,062.50 (VAT Inclusive)” included from our end. Please adjust accordingly.

 

 

Unquote

 

Thanks

Firas

Dear Tarek,

 

Kindly be informed that the loss adjuster have conducted the survey at the location and inspected the damage. He noted that the rainwater entered the building from the roof, apparently as a result of a defect in either the sealant or drainage system

Therefore, to progress the matter, we request you submit the following;

 

1.       Statement of claim; /attached.

2.       A copy of the list of the  total  stock  that was in the subject boutique on the subject date from the system with their values / attached

3.       Copies of the supplier’s invoices for the damaged stock items; https://we.tl/t-hluCC9FfgF <https://eur03.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwe.tl%2Ft-hluCC9FfgF&data=05%7C02%7CHagop.Ghazarian%40chalhoub.com%7C429b351efc42469deb6008dcf3f40d74%7C6ef8304cf37b42a5a5690a7d8249fbf3%7C0%7C0%7C638653476870909210%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=1%2BmOPs7uE9f5kpjbx6b%2B8MI7VXeA12p84xmiAcxy380%3D&reserved=0>   please download within 3 days.

4.       Cleaning expenses of the showroom from the water/attached.

	Dear Tarek,

	 

	I hope this message finds you well.

	 

	Thank you for visiting the CHANEL Jeddah store this afternoon and conducting a physical inspection. Based on your guidance, we have categorized the damaged stock into two groups:

	 

	• Totally damaged

	• Semi-damaged

	 

	We have placed all damaged items in a designated area for further inspection. As recommended, we have separated the wet and damaged boxes for the Insurance inspector's review during their visit.

	 

	Additionally, you observed and photographed various construction-related damages in the store, including issues with the ceiling, flooring, skirting, wallpaper, doors, shelves, kitchen hood and projector.

	Please note that the wooden flooring, skirting, and other wood components that have absorbed water may not show immediate damage but should become visible in the coming days.

	 

	The contractor has informed us that he will provide a preliminary report after tomorrow morning and a final report within a week.

	 

	As discussed, we aim to submit the list of damaged stock items by tomorrow at 11am.

	 

	Regarding the cleaning process, it is still ongoing, and we expect to receive the invoice from the cleaning company within the next two days.

	Dear Tarek,

	 

	As per your discussion with Joe, we will assess the Chanel Jeddah -El Khayat boutique situation and share with you the pictures, videos & Landed cost of the damaged items after segregating the stock.

	Additionally, as discussed, we will also provide pictures and videos related to the cleaning process.

	 

	As advised by you, the insurance company will rely on the data we share with them and there will be no need for an insurance surveyor to visit our boutique.

	Therefore, we can operate the boutique as normal from this afternoon onwards, Kindly confirm.

	 

	We will also try our best to check the CCTV and to provide you with the footage.

	 

	We will share the cost of the cleaning and provide you with an estimated cost for the boutique repairs after the contractor's assessment.

		Subject: Ceiling Leakage - Chanel Jeddah Elkhayat.

		 

		CAUTION: This email originated from outside of the organization. Do not click links or open attachments unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe.
		تم إرسال هذا البريد الإلكتروني من خارج مجموعة شلهوب. لا تنقر على الروابط أو تفتح المرفقات إلا إذا كنت تعرف المرسل وتعلم أنه آمن

		Dear Tarek.

		Good day.

		 

		Hope you are doing well.

		 

		 

		We are reaching out to let you know about an unfortunate incident at our Chanel Jeddah store last night. Due to the heavy rain, we experienced a water leakage from the ceiling, which has resulted in some damage to our items.

		 

		We're currently assessing the situation and will send you photos of the damaged items soon for the insurance claim.

		 

		Could you please let us know if someone from Nasco team can come to inspect the site?

		 

		Thanks in advance for your Support.

		 

		Regards, 

		Fashiuddin

Dear Firas,

 

I hope you’re doing well. Thank you for sharing the proposal.

 

Nujaima has requested to keep all the items, as there may be a need to send the damaged products to France if requested by the brand. Given this, we propose adjusting the settlement amount to SAR 625,000, down from the SAR 709,578, and retain the items.

 

This adjustment is also in the insurer’s favor, as it will noticeably reduce the net claim outlay.

 

If this proposal is acceptable, kindly provide us with the form of acceptance to sign, stamp, and return in order to close this claim.

 

As always, appreciate your continuous support.

 

Thank You & Best Regards,

Hagop

Quote

We have checked the same with the Insurers and they have agreed to the following :

 

1 destruction of the heavily damaged  100 bags under our watch supported by municipality destruction certificate

Unquote

Dear Firas,

 

I hope this message finds you well.

 

Thank you, as always, for your continued support.

 

We acknowledge the considerations raised regarding the salvage value of the damaged goods. However, in line with our standard practices for previous claims involving fully damaged items, we typically proceed by destroying these items in the presence of the surveyor to receive full compensation.

 

To avoid potential complexities or disputes concerning the brand and trademark clause, specifically regarding the feasibility of removing trademarks and obtaining salvage quotations for the material that remains, we propose the following to expedite settlement and ensure a fair resolution for all parties involved:

 

*	Fully Damaged Items: 

	*	We propose a reduction of 10% from the cost value.
	*	These items will be destroyed under the surveyor's supervision.

*	Partially Damaged Items: 

	*	We propose a reduction of 25% from the cost value.
	*	These items will be retained.

 

This approach is consistent with the methodology used during the Dhahran fire claim, aligns with policy conditions, and, we believe, benefits all parties involved.

 

We kindly request GIG’s confirmation that the above adjustments are acceptable so we can proceed to close this claim promptly.

Dear Tarek,

 

As discussed earlier, please see the below feedback received from the loss adjuster for your reference and advice,

 

Quote

We refer to the claim above and would like you to note that the fully or partially damaged items are valued and can be sold as salvage. Therefore, they retain salvage value. 

   

In the event of a claim for loss, destruction, or damage to branded goods, any salvage of branded goods and/or merchandise shall not be sold without the Insured's prior consent. If such salvage is not sold, the loss, destruction, or damage will be assessed at the value agreed upon between the Insured and the Insurers after removing brands, labels, or names by or on behalf of the Insured. The Insured has the right to remove the brand names from the products before selling them to any interested salvage party. Since removing the labels/brand names without damaging the products is difficult, if not impossible, the Insured must be open to discussing a reasonable percentage of depreciation allowance for the damaged goods with the Insurers.

 

We propose a 35% discount for partially damaged items and 20% for severely damaged items.

We propose a 35% discount for partially damaged items and 20% for severely damaged items. However, claiming a 100% depreciation allowance for the goods and retaining them must be corrected. The purpose of the brand and label clause is to prevent the sale of the branded goods through normal market channels. Therefore, the Insured should hand over the salvage after removing their labels from the goods (if possible), or else they have to destroy the goods in the presence of the adjuster and submit a destruction certificate.  

 

Having said the above, for the Insured to retain the damaged goods, we suggest the following:

Dear Tarek,

 

Please find below the loss feedback on the submitted documents and requirements,

 

Quote

 

We would like the following clarifications on the stock, fittings, and fixtures.

 

Stock

 

*	The damaged stock items are divided into two parts: fully damaged items and partially damaged items. We would be pleased to receive the Insured’s decisions regarding the partially damaged items. Please advise

For partially damaged items, as per brand policy to be considered as TOTAL DAMAGED as its not salable. Therefore, to be considered as total loss.

*	The supporting supplier’s invoices were reviewed, and we noted that the stock items we could identify showed prices less than the value claimed.  We will adjust the same accordingly;
*	The damaged stock items retain value. Therefore, if the Insured wishes to retain them, please ask them to submit their quotation. Please advise

Unfortunately, as per brand standards we cannot transfer or sell partially damaged items.

 

Fittings and Fixtures  

 

We have noted that Boulevard Co's claim for cleaning/repairing, etc., in the sum of SR.20,700 is based on a proforma invoice, and the Blue Print's claim in the sum of SR.92,675.63 on a quotation. Have the two companies completed the repair/reinstatement works?

Please note, the revised claim attached has “Trouble Shooting & repair of Fire Alarm System- BLUE PRINT SAR 10,062.50 (VAT Inclusive)” included from our end. Please adjust accordingly.

 

 

Unquote

 

Thanks

Firas

Dear Tarek,

 

Kindly be informed that the loss adjuster have conducted the survey at the location and inspected the damage. He noted that the rainwater entered the building from the roof, apparently as a result of a defect in either the sealant or drainage system

Therefore, to progress the matter, we request you submit the following;

 

1.       Statement of claim; /attached.

2.       A copy of the list of the  total  stock  that was in the subject boutique on the subject date from the system with their values / attached

3.       Copies of the supplier’s invoices for the damaged stock items; https://we.tl/t-hluCC9FfgF <https://eur03.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwe.tl%2Ft-hluCC9FfgF&data=05%7C02%7CHagop.Ghazarian%40chalhoub.com%7Cfc584e161de044b7f25808dcf40be601%7C6ef8304cf37b42a5a5690a7d8249fbf3%7C0%7C0%7C638653579227650524%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=AGZZf62E3LVW822NRvlyhVmhL0OIJASuKbPGv%2Fea5NA%3D&reserved=0>   please download within 3 days.

4.       Cleaning expenses of the showroom from the water/attached.

	Dear Tarek,

	 

	I hope this message finds you well.

	 

	Thank you for visiting the CHANEL Jeddah store this afternoon and conducting a physical inspection. Based on your guidance, we have categorized the damaged stock into two groups:

	 

	• Totally damaged

	• Semi-damaged

	 

	We have placed all damaged items in a designated area for further inspection. As recommended, we have separated the wet and damaged boxes for the Insurance inspector's review during their visit.

	 

	Additionally, you observed and photographed various construction-related damages in the store, including issues with the ceiling, flooring, skirting, wallpaper, doors, shelves, kitchen hood and projector.

	Please note that the wooden flooring, skirting, and other wood components that have absorbed water may not show immediate damage but should become visible in the coming days.

	 

	The contractor has informed us that he will provide a preliminary report after tomorrow morning and a final report within a week.

	 

	As discussed, we aim to submit the list of damaged stock items by tomorrow at 11am.

	 

	Regarding the cleaning process, it is still ongoing, and we expect to receive the invoice from the cleaning company within the next two days.

Joe Bou Rjeili

	Dear Tarek,

	 

	As per your discussion with Joe, we will assess the Chanel Jeddah -El Khayat boutique situation and share with you the pictures, videos & Landed cost of the damaged items after segregating the stock.

	Additionally, as discussed, we will also provide pictures and videos related to the cleaning process.

	 

	As advised by you, the insurance company will rely on the data we share with them and there will be no need for an insurance surveyor to visit our boutique.

	Therefore, we can operate the boutique as normal from this afternoon onwards, Kindly confirm.

	 

	We will also try our best to check the CCTV and to provide you with the footage.

	 

	We will share the cost of the cleaning and provide you with an estimated cost for the boutique repairs after the contractor's assessment.

	 

	Regards

	Fashiuddin Jaffar

		Subject: Ceiling Leakage - Chanel Jeddah Elkhayat.

		تم إرسال هذا البريد الإلكتروني من خارج مجموعة شلهوب. لا تنقر على الروابط أو تفتح المرفقات إلا إذا كنت تعرف المرسل وتعلم أنه آمن

		Dear Tarek.

		Good day.

		 

		Hope you are doing well.

		 

		 

		We are reaching out to let you know about an unfortunate incident at our Chanel Jeddah store last night. Due to the heavy rain, we experienced a water leakage from the ceiling, which has resulted in some damage to our items.

		 

		We're currently assessing the situation and will send you photos of the damaged items soon for the insurance claim.

		 

		Could you please let us know if someone from Nasco team can come to inspect the site?

		 

		Thanks in advance for your Support.

		 

		Regards, 

		Fashiuddin

Dear Firas,

 

I hope this message finds you well.

 

Thank you, as always, for your continued support.

 

We acknowledge the considerations raised regarding the salvage value of the damaged goods. However, in line with our standard practices for previous claims involving fully damaged items, we typically proceed by destroying these items in the presence of the surveyor to receive full compensation.

 

To avoid potential complexities or disputes concerning the brand and trademark clause, specifically regarding the feasibility of removing trademarks and obtaining salvage quotations for the material that remains, we propose the following to expedite settlement and ensure a fair resolution for all parties involved:

 

*	Fully Damaged Items: 

	*	We propose a reduction of 10% from the cost value.
	*	These items will be destroyed under the surveyor's supervision.

*	Partially Damaged Items: 

	*	We propose a reduction of 25% from the cost value.
	*	These items will be retained.

 

This approach is consistent with the methodology used during the Dhahran fire claim, aligns with policy conditions, and, we believe, benefits all parties involved.

 

We kindly request GIG’s confirmation that the above adjustments are acceptable so we can proceed to close this claim promptly.

Dear Tarek,

 

As discussed earlier, please see the below feedback received from the loss adjuster for your reference and advice,

 

Quote

We refer to the claim above and would like you to note that the fully or partially damaged items are valued and can be sold as salvage. Therefore, they retain salvage value. 

   

In the event of a claim for loss, destruction, or damage to branded goods, any salvage of branded goods and/or merchandise shall not be sold without the Insured's prior consent. If such salvage is not sold, the loss, destruction, or damage will be assessed at the value agreed upon between the Insured and the Insurers after removing brands, labels, or names by or on behalf of the Insured. The Insured has the right to remove the brand names from the products before selling them to any interested salvage party. Since removing the labels/brand names without damaging the products is difficult, if not impossible, the Insured must be open to discussing a reasonable percentage of depreciation allowance for the damaged goods with the Insurers.

 

We propose a 35% discount for partially damaged items and 20% for severely damaged items.

The purpose of the brand and label clause is to prevent the sale of the branded goods through normal market channels. Therefore, the Insured should hand over the salvage after removing their labels from the goods (if possible), or else they have to destroy the goods in the presence of the adjuster and submit a destruction certificate.  

 

Having said the above, for the Insured to retain the damaged goods, we suggest the following:

Dear Tarek,

 

Please find below the loss feedback on the submitted documents and requirements,

 

Quote

 

We would like the following clarifications on the stock, fittings, and fixtures.

 

Stock

 

*	The damaged stock items are divided into two parts: fully damaged items and partially damaged items. We would be pleased to receive the Insured’s decisions regarding the partially damaged items. Please advise

For partially damaged items, as per brand policy to be considered as TOTAL DAMAGED as its not salable. Therefore, to be considered as total loss.

*	The supporting supplier’s invoices were reviewed, and we noted that the stock items we could identify showed prices less than the value claimed.  We will adjust the same accordingly;
*	The damaged stock items retain value. Therefore, if the Insured wishes to retain them, please ask them to submit their quotation. Please advise

Unfortunately, as per brand standards we cannot transfer or sell partially damaged items.

 

Fittings and Fixtures  

 

We have noted that Boulevard Co's claim for cleaning/repairing, etc., in the sum of SR.20,700 is based on a proforma invoice, and the Blue Print's claim in the sum of SR.92,675.63 on a quotation. Have the two companies completed the repair/reinstatement works? If so, we require the actual invoices and evidence of the payment made to them. Please advise

We will share proof of payment soon, for BLUE PRINT the work is still in progress as of now.

Dear Tarek,

 

Kindly be informed that the loss adjuster have conducted the survey at the location and inspected the damage. He noted that the rainwater entered the building from the roof, apparently as a result of a defect in either the sealant or drainage system

Therefore, to progress the matter, we request you submit the following;

 

1.       Statement of claim; /attached.

2.       A copy of the list of the  total  stock  that was in the subject boutique on the subject date from the system with their values / attached

3.       Copies of the supplier’s invoices for the damaged stock items; https://we.tl/t-hluCC9FfgF  please download within 3 days.

4.       Cleaning expenses of the showroom from the water/attached.

5.       Repair invoices for the part of the ceiling and/or the parkie floor affected by the water; @Joe Bourjeili <mailto:joe.bourjeili@etoilegroup.com> 

6.       A copy of the letter sent to the landlord for the loss/damage caused by the water due to the defective roof of the building and their reply /attached.

7.       We understand that the showroom was opened for trade within a day or two.

	Dear Tarek,

	 

	I hope this message finds you well.

	 

	Thank you for visiting the CHANEL Jeddah store this afternoon and conducting a physical inspection. Based on your guidance, we have categorized the damaged stock into two groups:

	 

	• Totally damaged

	• Semi-damaged

	 

	We have placed all damaged items in a designated area for further inspection. As recommended, we have separated the wet and damaged boxes for the Insurance inspector's review during their visit.

	 

	Additionally, you observed and photographed various construction-related damages in the store, including issues with the ceiling, flooring, skirting, wallpaper, doors, shelves, kitchen hood and projector.

	Please note that the wooden flooring, skirting, and other wood components that have absorbed water may not show immediate damage but should become visible in the coming days.

	 

	The contractor has informed us that he will provide a preliminary report after tomorrow morning and a final report within a week.

	 

	As discussed, we aim to submit the list of damaged stock items by tomorrow at 11am.

	 

	Regarding the cleaning process, it is still ongoing, and we expect to receive the invoice from the cleaning company within the next two days.

	Dear Tarek,

	 

	As per your discussion with Joe, we will assess the Chanel Jeddah -El Khayat boutique situation and share with you the pictures, videos & Landed cost of the damaged items after segregating the stock.

	Additionally, as discussed, we will also provide pictures and videos related to the cleaning process.

	 

	As advised by you, the insurance company will rely on the data we share with them and there will be no need for an insurance surveyor to visit our boutique.

	Therefore, we can operate the boutique as normal from this afternoon onwards, Kindly confirm.

	 

	We will also try our best to check the CCTV and to provide you with the footage.

	 

	We will share the cost of the cleaning and provide you with an estimated cost for the boutique repairs after the contractor's assessment.

	 

	Regards

We are reaching out to let you know about an unfortunate incident at our Chanel Jeddah store last night. Due to the heavy rain, we experienced a water leakage from the ceiling, which has resulted in some damage to our items.

		 

		We're currently assessing the situation and will send you photos of the damaged items soon for the insurance claim.

		 

		Could you please let us know if someone from Nasco team can come to inspect the site?

		 

		Thanks in advance for your Support.

		 

		Regards, 

		Fashiuddin

	Dear Firas,

	 

	I hope you’re doing well. Thank you for sharing the proposal.

	 

	Nujaima has requested to keep all the items, as there may be a need to send the damaged products to France if requested by the brand. Given this, we propose adjusting the settlement amount to SAR 625,000, down from the SAR 709,578, and retain the items.

	 

	This adjustment is also in the insurer’s favor, as it will noticeably reduce the net claim outlay.

	 

	If this proposal is acceptable, kindly provide us with the form of acceptance to sign, stamp, and return in order to close this claim.

	 

	As always, appreciate your continuous support.

	Hagop

	CAUTION: This email originated from outside of the organization. Do not click links or open attachments unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe.

	 

	Dear Firas,

	 

	I hope this message finds you well.

	 

	Thank you, as always, for your continued support.

	 

	We acknowledge the considerations raised regarding the salvage value of the damaged goods. However, in line with our standard practices for previous claims involving fully damaged items, we typically proceed by destroying these items in the presence of the surveyor to receive full compensation.

	 

	To avoid potential complexities or disputes concerning the brand and trademark clause, specifically regarding the feasibility of removing trademarks and obtaining salvage quotations for the material that remains, we propose the following to expedite settlement and ensure a fair resolution for all parties involved:

	 

	*	Fully Damaged Items: 

		*	We propose a reduction of 10% from the cost value.
		*	These items will be destroyed under the surveyor's supervision.

	*	Partially Damaged Items: 

		*	We propose a reduction of 25% from the cost value.
		*	These items will be retained.

	 

	This approach is consistent with the methodology used during the Dhahran fire claim, aligns with policy conditions, and, we believe, benefits all parties involved.

	 

	We kindly request GIG’s confirmation that the above adjustments are acceptable so we can proceed to close this claim promptly.

	Dear Tarek,

	 

	As discussed earlier, please see the below feedback received from the loss adjuster for your reference and advice,

	 

	Quote

	We refer to the claim above and would like you to note that the fully or partially damaged items are valued and can be sold as salvage. Therefore, they retain salvage value. 

	   

	In the event of a claim for loss, destruction, or damage to branded goods, any salvage of branded goods and/or merchandise shall not be sold without the Insured's prior consent. If such salvage is not sold, the loss, destruction, or damage will be assessed at the value agreed upon between the Insured and the Insurers after removing brands, labels, or names by or on behalf of the Insured. The Insured has the right to remove the brand names from the products before selling them to any interested salvage party. Since removing the labels/brand names without damaging the products is difficult, if not impossible, the Insured must be open to discussing a reasonable percentage of depreciation allowance for the damaged goods with the Insurers.

	 

	We propose a 35% discount for partially damaged items and 20% for severely damaged items.

We propose a 35% discount for partially damaged items and 20% for severely damaged items. However, claiming a 100% depreciation allowance for the goods and retaining them must be corrected. The purpose of the brand and label clause is to prevent the sale of the branded goods through normal market channels. Therefore, the Insured should hand over the salvage after removing their labels from the goods (if possible), or else they have to destroy the goods in the presence of the adjuster and submit a destruction certificate.  

	 

	Having said the above, for the Insured to retain the damaged goods, we suggest the following:

	Firas

	Dear Tarek,

	 

	Please find below the loss feedback on the submitted documents and requirements,

	 

	Quote

	 

	We would like the following clarifications on the stock, fittings, and fixtures.

	 

	Stock

	 

	*	The damaged stock items are divided into two parts: fully damaged items and partially damaged items. We would be pleased to receive the Insured’s decisions regarding the partially damaged items. Please advise

	For partially damaged items, as per brand policy to be considered as TOTAL DAMAGED as its not salable. Therefore, to be considered as total loss.

	*	The supporting supplier’s invoices were reviewed, and we noted that the stock items we could identify showed prices less than the value claimed.  We will adjust the same accordingly;
	*	The damaged stock items retain value. Therefore, if the Insured wishes to retain them, please ask them to submit their quotation. Please advise

	Unfortunately, as per brand standards we cannot transfer or sell partially damaged items.

	 

	Fittings and Fixtures  

	 

	We have noted that Boulevard Co's claim for cleaning/repairing, etc., in the sum of SR.20,700 is based on a proforma invoice, and the Blue Print's claim in the sum of SR.92,675.63 on a quotation.

vetlana.Moiseeva@etoilegroup.com> >; Fashiuddin Jaffar <Fashiuddin.Jaffar@etoilegroup.com <mailto:Fashiuddin.Jaffar@etoilegroup.com> >
		Subject: RE: Ceiling Leakage - Chanel Jeddah Elkhayat.

		 

		CAUTION: This email originated from outside of the organization. Do not click links or open attachments unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe.
		تم إرسال هذا البريد الإلكتروني من خارج مجموعة شلهوب. لا تنقر على الروابط أو تفتح المرفقات إلا إذا كنت تعرف المرسل وتعلم أنه آمن

		Dear Tarek,

		 

		I hope this message finds you well.

		 

		Thank you for visiting the CHANEL Jeddah store this afternoon and conducting a physical inspection. Based on your guidance, we have categorized the damaged stock into two groups:

		 

		• Totally damaged

		• Semi-damaged

		 

		We have placed all damaged items in a designated area for further inspection. As recommended, we have separated the wet and damaged boxes for the Insurance inspector's review during their visit.

		 

		Additionally, you observed and photographed various construction-related damages in the store, including issues with the ceiling, flooring, skirting, wallpaper, doors, shelves, kitchen hood and projector.

		Please note that the wooden flooring, skirting, and other wood components that have absorbed water may not show immediate damage but should become visible in the coming days.

		 

		The contractor has informed us that he will provide a preliminary report after tomorrow morning and a final report within a week.

		 

		As discussed, we aim to submit the list of damaged stock items by tomorrow at 11am.

Joe Bou Rjeili

		Dear Tarek,

		 

		As per your discussion with Joe, we will assess the Chanel Jeddah -El Khayat boutique situation and share with you the pictures, videos & Landed cost of the damaged items after segregating the stock.

		Additionally, as discussed, we will also provide pictures and videos related to the cleaning process.

		 

		As advised by you, the insurance company will rely on the data we share with them and there will be no need for an insurance surveyor to visit our boutique.

		Therefore, we can operate the boutique as normal from this afternoon onwards, Kindly confirm.

		 

		We will also try our best to check the CCTV and to provide you with the footage.

		 

		We will share the cost of the cleaning and provide you with an estimated cost for the boutique repairs after the contractor's assessment.

		 

		Regards

		Fashiuddin Jaffar
